gyrokinetics_local.documentation: Description of a local gyrokinetic simulation (delta-f, flux-tube). All quantities within this IDS are normalised (apart from time and from the normalizing quantities structure), thus independent of rhostar, consistently with the local approximation and a spectral representation is assumed in the perpendicular plane (i.e. homogeneous turbulence).

gyrokinetics_local.code.documentation: Generic decription of the code-specific parameters for the code that has produced this IDS

gyrokinetics_local.code.description.documentation: Short description of the software (type, purpose)

gyrokinetics_local.code.library.documentation: List of external libraries used by the code that has produced this IDS

gyrokinetics_local.code.library[:].descr.documentation: Short description of the software (type, purpose)

gyrokinetics_local.code.library[:].param.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

gyrokinetics_local.code.output_flag.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values mean some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used.

gyrokinetics_local.code.parameters.documentation: List of the code specific parameters in XML format

gyrokinetics_local.collisions.collisiona.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "collisionality_norm"

gyrokinetics_local.flux_surface.b_field_.documentation: Sign of the toroidal magnetic field
Index in the error_description list for "b_field_tor_sign"

gyrokinetics_local.flux_surface.dc_dr_mi.documentation: Derivative of the 'c' shape coefficients with respect to r_minor_norm
Index in the error_description list for "dc_dr_minor_norm"

gyrokinetics_local.flux_surface.delongat.documentation: Derivative of the elongation with respect to r_minor_norm
Index in the error_description list for "delongation_dr_minor_norm"

gyrokinetics_local.flux_surface.dgeometr.documentation: Derivative of the major radius of the surface geometric axis with respect to r_minor
Index in the error_description list for "dgeometric_axis_r_dr_minor"
Derivative of the height of the surface geometric axis with respect to r_minor
Index in the error_description list for "dgeometric_axis_z_dr_minor"

gyrokinetics_local.flux_surface.ds_dr_mi.documentation: Derivative of the 's' shape coefficients with respect to r_minor_norm
Index in the error_description list for "ds_dr_minor_norm"

gyrokinetics_local.flux_surface.elongati.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "elongation"

gyrokinetics_local.flux_surface.ip_sign_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "ip_sign"

gyrokinetics_local.flux_surface.magnetic.documentation: Magnetic shear, defined as r_minor_norm/q . dq/dr_minor_norm (different definition from the equilibrium IDS)
Index in the error_description list for "magnetic_shear_r_minor"

gyrokinetics_local.flux_surface.pressure.documentation: Normalised pressure gradient (derivative with respect to r_minor_norm)
Index in the error_description list for "pressure_gradient_norm"

gyrokinetics_local.flux_surface.q_error_.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "q"

gyrokinetics_local.flux_surface.r_minor_.documentation: Normalised minor radius of the flux surface of interest = 1/2 * (max(R) - min(R))/L_ref
Index in the error_description list for "r_minor_norm"

gyrokinetics_local.flux_surface.shape_co.documentation: 'c' coefficients in the formula defining the shape of the flux surface
Index in the error_description list for "shape_coefficients_c"
's' coefficients in the formula defining the shape of the flux surface
Index in the error_description list for "shape_coefficients_s"

gyrokinetics_local.ids_properties.documentation: Interface Data Structure properties. This element identifies the node above as an IDS

gyrokinetics_local.ids_properties.commen.documentation: Any comment describing the content of this IDS

gyrokinetics_local.ids_properties.creati.documentation: Date at which this data has been produced

gyrokinetics_local.ids_properties.homoge.documentation: This node must be filled (with 0, 1, or 2) for the IDS to be valid. If 1, the time of this IDS is homogeneous, i.e. the time values for this IDS are stored in the time node just below the root of this IDS. If 0, the time values are stored in the various time fields at lower levels in the tree. In the case only constant or static nodes are filled within the IDS, homogeneous_time must be set to 2

gyrokinetics_local.ids_properties.name.documentation: User-defined name for this IDS occurrence

gyrokinetics_local.ids_properties.occurr.documentation:
Type of data contained in this occurrence
1) reconstruction : Equilibrium reconstruction
2) prediction_fixed : Equilibrium prediction, fixed boundary
3) prediction_free : Equilibrium prediction, free boundary
4) mapping : Used for mapping equilibrium results from one grid type / resolution to another, or for including variables not present in the first set such as the calculation of magnetic field of other derived parameters
Integer identifier (enumeration index within a list). Private identifier values must be indicated by a negative index.

gyrokinetics_local.ids_properties.plugin.documentation: Information about the plugins used to write/read this IDS. This structure is filled automatically by the Access Layer at GET/PUT time, no need to fill it via a user program.
Plugin infrastructure used to GET the data
Short description of the software (type, purpose)
Plugin infrastructure used to PUT the data
Short description of the software (type, purpose)
Set of IDS nodes for which a plugin has been applied

Plugins actually used to read back a node (potentially, multiple plugins can be applied, listed in reverse order of application). This information is filled by the plugin infrastructure during the GET operation.
Short description of the software (type, purpose)
List of the code specific parameters in XML format
Path of the node within the IDS, following the syntax given in the link below. If empty, means the plugin applies to the whole IDS.
Plugins used to PUT a node (potentially, multiple plugins can be applied, if so they are listed by order of application)
Short description of the software (type, purpose)
List of the code specific parameters in XML format
Plugins to be used to read back a node (potentially, multiple plugins can be applied, listed in reverse order of application)
Short description of the software (type, purpose)
List of the code specific parameters in XML format

gyrokinetics_local.ids_properties.proven.documentation: Set of IDS nodes for which the provenance is given. The provenance information applies to the whole structure below the IDS node. For documenting provenance information for the whole IDS, set the size of this array of structure to 1 and leave the child "path" node empty
Path of the node within the IDS, following the syntax given in the link below. If empty, means the provenance information applies to the whole IDS.

List of sources used to import or calculate this node, identified as explained below. In case the node is the result of of a calculation / data processing, the source is an input to the process described in the "code" structure at the root of the IDS. The source can be an IDS (identified by a URI or a persitent identifier, see syntax in the link below) or non-IDS data imported directly from an non-IMAS database (identified by the command used to import the source, or the persistent identifier of the data source). Often data are obtained by a chain of processes, however only the last process input are recorded here. The full chain of provenance has then to be reconstructed recursively from the provenance information contained in the data sources.

gyrokinetics_local.ids_properties.provid.documentation: Name of the person in charge of producing this data

gyrokinetics_local.ids_properties.source.documentation: Source of the data (any comment describing the origin of the data : code, path to diagnostic signals, processing method, ...). Superseeded by the new provenance structure.

gyrokinetics_local.ids_properties.versio.documentation: Version of the access layer package used to PUT this IDS
Version of Access Layer used to PUT this IDS
Programming language of the Access Layer high level API used to PUT this IDS
Version of Data Dictionary used to PUT this IDS

gyrokinetics_local.linear.wavevector[:]..documentation: Normalised binormal component of the wavevector
Index in the error_description list for "binormal_wavevector_norm"
Set of eigenmode for this wavector

Poloidal angle grid. The angle is defined with respect to (R0,Z0) with R0=(Rmax-Rmin)/2 and Z0=(Zmax-Zmin)/2. It is increasing clockwise. So (r,theta,phi) is right-handed. theta=0 for Z=Z0 and R>R0 (LFS)
Index in the error_description list for "angle_pol"
Code-specific parameters used for this eigenmode
Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values mean some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used.

gyrokinetics_local.model.adiabatic_elect.documentation: Flag = 1 if electrons are adiabatic, 0 otherwise

gyrokinetics_local.model.collisions_ener.documentation: Flag = 1 if the collision operator conserves energy, 0 otherwise

gyrokinetics_local.model.collisions_fini.documentation: Flag = 1 if finite larmor radius effects are retained in the collision operator, 0 otherwise

gyrokinetics_local.model.collisions_mome.documentation: Flag = 1 if the collision operator conserves momentum, 0 otherwise

gyrokinetics_local.model.collisions_pitc.documentation: Flag = 1 if only pitch-angle scattering is retained, 0 otherwise

gyrokinetics_local.model.include_a_field.documentation: Flag = 1 if fluctuations of the parallel vector potential are retained, 0 otherwise

gyrokinetics_local.model.include_b_field.documentation: Flag = 1 if fluctuations of the parallel magnetic field are retained, 0 otherwise

gyrokinetics_local.model.include_centrif.documentation: Flag = 1 if centrifugal effects are retained, 0 otherwise

gyrokinetics_local.model.include_corioli.documentation: Flag = 1 if Coriolis drift is included, 0 otherwise

gyrokinetics_local.model.include_full_cu.documentation: Flag = 1 if all contributions to the curvature drift are included (including beta_prime), 0 otherwise. Neglecting the beta_prime contribution (Flag=0) is only recommended together with the neglect of parallel magnetic field fluctuations

gyrokinetics_local.non_linear.angle_pol.documentation: Poloidal angle grid. The angle is defined with respect to (R0,Z0) with R0=(Rmax-Rmin)/2 and Z0=(Zmax-Zmin)/2. It is increasing clockwise. So (r,theta,phi) is right-handed. theta=0 for Z=Z0 and R>R0 (LFS)

gyrokinetics_local.normalizing_quantitie.documentation: Physical quantities used for normalization (useful to link to the original simulation/experience)
Toroidal magnetic field at major radius r
Index in the error_description list for "b_field_tor"
Electron density at outboard equatorial midplane of the flux surface (angle_pol = 0)
Index in the error_description list for "n_e"
Major radius of the flux surface of interest, defined as (min(R)+max(R))/2

gyrokinetics_local.species[:].charge_nor.documentation: Index in the error_description list for "charge_norm"

gyrokinetics_local.species_all.documentation: Physical quantities common to all species

gyrokinetics_local.species_all.angle_pol.documentation: Poloidal angle grid, from -pi to pi, on which the species dependent effective potential energy (which determines the poloidal variation of the density) is expressed. The angle is defined with respect to (R0,Z0) with R0=(Rmax-Rmin)/2 and Z0=(Zmax-Zmin)/2. It is increasing clockwise. So (r,theta,phi) is right-handed. theta=0 for Z=Z0 and R>R0 (LFS)
Index in the error_description list for "angle_pol"

gyrokinetics_local.species_all.beta_refe.documentation: Reference plasma beta (see detailed documentation at the root of the IDS)
Index in the error_description list for "beta_reference"

gyrokinetics_local.species_all.debye_len.documentation: Debye length computed from the reference quantities (see detailed documentation at the root of the IDS)
Index in the error_description list for "debye_length_norm"

gyrokinetics_local.species_all.shearing_.documentation: Normalised ExB shearing rate (for non-linear runs only)
Index in the error_description list for "shearing_rate_norm"

gyrokinetics_local.species_all.velocity_.documentation: Normalised toroidal velocity of species (all species are assumed to have a purely toroidal velocity with a common toroidal angular frequency)
Index in the error_description list for "velocity_tor_norm"
